chapter.title: &slepos; Installation
chapter.para: &slepos; is distributed as an add-on product for &sls; 12 SP2 systems. To install &slepos; 3.1, install the &sls; 12 SP2 base system first. You can choose to install the &slepos; add-on together with your base system during the initial installation process, or you can install the &slepos; add-on on top of an already installed base system at any later time.

sect1.title: Installation During the Initial Installation Process
sect1.para: To install &slepos; add-on together with your base system during the initial installation process, follow these steps:

step.para: Start &sls; 12 SP2 installation as usual. For more information, see the &sls; documentation.
To include the &slepos; add-on product, check the Include Add-On Products from Separate Media option in the Installation Mode dialog in the System Analysis step and click Next.

Click Add. If you are installing &slepos; from a CD medium, select CD as the source type. If you are installing from a different source, such as NFS or HTTP, choose the appropriate source type. Click Next.
If you are installing from CD, insert the &slepos; add-on product CD. If you are installing from a different source, provide the necessary source. Click Continue.
Confirm the &slepos; license agreement and click Next.
The &slepos; add-on product is displayed in the overview. Click Next and continue with the installation as usual.

In the Entering Migration Data step of the installation, you can enter &slepos; migration data. Select the appropriate Path to Archive File or Path to Back-up Directory and click Next. For more information about &slepos; migration, see .

In the Server Pattern Selection step of the installation, select the &slepos; patterns appropriate for the type of server you are installing. For &admserv;, select the &slepos; for &admserv; pattern. For &branchserv;, select the &slepos; for &branchserv; pattern. For &imgserv;, select the &slepos-old; &imgserv; pattern.

You can combine patterns to install a server with multiple functions. For example, for an &admserv; and &branchserv; combination, select both &slepos; for &admserv; and &slepos; for &branchserv; patterns.

sect1.title: Installation On Top of an Already Installed System
sect1.para: To install &slepos; on top of an already installed base system, follow these steps:

step.para: Start &yast; and select Software Add-On Products Add .

Select media type to be used for installation. If you are installing &slepos; from a CD medium, select CD as the source type. If you are installing from a different source, such as NFS or HTTP, choose the appropriate source type. Click Next.
If you are installing from CD, insert the &slepos; add-on product CD. If you are installing from a different source, provide the necessary source. Click Continue.
Confirm the &slepos; license agreement and click Next.

In the Entering Migration Data, you can enter &slepos; migration data. Select the appropriate Path to archive file or Path to backup directory and click Next. For more information about &slepos; migration, see .

In the Server Pattern Selection step of the installation, select the &slepos; patterns appropriate for the type of server you are installing. For &admserv;, select the &slepos; for &admserv; pattern. For &branchserv;, select the &slepos; for &branchserv; pattern. For &imgserv;, select the &slepos-old; for &imgserv; pattern.

You can combine patterns to install a server with multiple functions. For example, for an &admserv; and &branchserv; combination, select both &slepos; for &admserv; and &slepos; for &branchserv; patterns.
